executive_summary: Direct Mail Advertisers commonly provide a less expensive alternative to traditional advertising outlets, such as TV, radio and magazines, by delivering customized marketing materials and coupons straight to consumers' doorsteps via post. Even so, increasing competition from digital advertising threatens the industry. Recent declines in advertising expenditure caused by the 2020 pandemic darkened the industry's prospects. These economic woes have exacerbated an ongoing decline in print advertising that has plagued the industry.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Emerging Trends Suppress Demand for Direct Mail Advertising
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The popularity of computers, smartphones and tablets helps affordable and highly personalized marketing alternatives, such as e-mail, website and social media advertising. The mounting amount of business conducted online has endangered industry services, as digital marketing saps demand away from direct mail advertisers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Integrated Marketing Strategies Pose a Growth Opportunity
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The pandemic resulted in lower spending for printed media, as companies allocate fewer resources to direct mail than to digital advertisement during times of uncertainty. An increasing number of companies have moved to integrated advertising strategies, where advertisers combine digital and physical tools, improving the user's overall experience.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: US Postal Service (USPS) Supports Direct Mail Advertising
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The United States Postal Service provides an extensive directory of local printers, marketing-service companies and direct mail advertisers that help small businesses create and produce in-mail promotions. The facilitating role that the USPS plays in the direct mail advertising industry is increasingly valuable to industry enterprises as it acts as a vehicle for companies to engage with new markets.

USPS offers temporary promotions designed to generate continued interest in direct mail, such as a 2.0% discount on all direct mail advertising equipped with near-field communication, video in print or QR codes. Promotions encourage mailers to integrate direct mail with technologies that enable the recipient to engage in an interactive experience.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Budget cuts during the early stages of the pandemic increased delivery times
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Budget cuts during the early stages of the pandemic increased delivery times, negatively affecting advertisers that rely on speedy mail delivery for their service. As macroeconomic conditions improved recent surges in the number of businesses has created an opportunity for direct mail advertisers to recoup lost demand.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: G R O W I N G  C O M P E T I T I O N  L I M I T S  O P P O R T U N I T I E S  F O R  D I R E C T M A I L  M A R K E T I N G
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The use of coupons and sales have traditionally been sent to users through the mail. This trend has shifted toward e-mail, enabling companies to reach the right person regardless of moves or changes in addresses, and this shift is emblematic of a greater pivot towards digitization and away from print.

Growing levels of external competition have pushed certain direct mail advertisers to cease or sell their operations, this has pressure has been amplified by severe revenue struggles especially for smaller less profitable enterprises.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: A crucial downfall of direct mail advertising is its inability to target an audience with the same accuracy as digital advertisements. With the rise of artificial intelligence and social media algorithms, digital advertisers can target multiple variations of specific audiences at a very granular level.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: DIRECT MAILERS TRY TO STAY AFLOAT
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Continuous pressure from alternative targeted advertising, such as online, mobile and e-mail platforms, will force advertisers to continue implementing integrated marketing strategies or risk being left behind.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Direct mail is becoming more personalized
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Direct mail is becoming more personalized through its integration with digital advertising technologies, making the industry better equipped to compete with highly personalized online marketing. Still, only the industry's most prominent companies have the capacity and funds to achieve this type of integration, leaving the majority of enterprises in the dark.
In hopes of staying competitive and above water, direct mailers will invest in improving their data capabilities to better target and segment consumers with highly customized offers and information.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: New market trends create opportunities for advertisers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Improving economic conditions will increase consumer spending, driving advertising and promotional expenditure growth, ultimately benefiting the industry. A continued incline in the number of businesses will further support industry activity as the potential pool of clients for direct mail advertisers expands. Due to environmental concerns, advertisers have begun to invest in environmentally-friendly materials for direct mailing campaigns, including recycled paper, chemical-free paper or paper made from wood-based pulp.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Investment to electrify US Postal Service
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: In December 2022, the Biden administration announced an investment of $9.6 billion to electrify the USPS' fleets. Seeing as the USPS is responsible for facilitating a portion of industry activity, this investment could pay dividends for the industry.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Even so, even the USPS is adjusting to a post digital marketing dominated world
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Even so, even the USPS is adjusting to a post digital marketing dominated world, as the organization's 2024 incentives offer a 30% postage credit for increased mail volumes, aiming to blend direct mail with digital marketing strategies. The program encourages a multichannel approach, integrating direct mail with digital to cater to a changing market.

industry_definition: Direct mail advertisers distribute advertising materials (e.g. coupons, flyers and samples) or specialty items (e.g. key chains, magnets and pens with custom printed messages) by mail or other methods of direct distribution. Industry participants may also prepare advertising materials or specialties for mailing or other direct distribution. They may also compile, maintain, sell and rent mailing lists.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - steady

key_trends: Rapidly growing competition from digital advertisement forces direct mailers to innovate. By implementing integrated marketing campaigns, direct mail advertisers can partly insulate themselves against external competition.
Start-ups are a growing market for direct mail advertisers. Start-ups seeking to differentiate themselves are looking into using direct mail marketing to build their brands.
Increases in total advertising expenditure show the fall in direct mail advertisers. The falling revenue of direct mail demonstrated the increasing dominance of social media as an advertisement tool.
Improvements in USPS infrastructure and vehicles will lower costs for direct mailers. This will facilitate greater profit earning potential and help mitigate demand losses.
The pandemic resulted in losses from most major markets. The travel industry was particularly affected by travel regulations, limiting marketing spending.
The implementation of integrated marketing strategies supports the use of direct mail products. Companies can reach a wider audience by using printed and digital media to promote goods and services.
Companies located in California and New York have more access to PR and marketing agencies. This allows for improved relationships and more efficient integrated marketing campaigns.

Population-dense regions are not beneficial for most direct mail advertisers. Many small businesses that rely on direct mail services are located in less populated areas, causing enterprises to be dispersed somewhat evenly across the country.
The emergence of digital advertising threatens direct mail companies. Digital media is better at targeting and reaching users, negatively affecting demand for direct mail.

Direct mail advertisers diversify their toolbox by implementing new technologies. Using QR codes, direct mail triggers and voice activated call to action enables companies to target potential customers better.
Major companies continue to engage in mergers and acquisitions. Falling revenue pushes major players towards acquiring other companies to maintain market share and operations.

Direct mail advertisers join marketing agencies to offer integrated marketing campaigns. Using physical and digital marketing materials allows campaigns to reach a more comprehensive group of potential customers.
Companies look to reduce expenses amid falling revenue. Advertisers aim to reduce wage costs by increasing efficiency through automation and technology integration.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Retail stores and consumer goods manufacturers use industry services to communicate directly with consumers about sales and to promote their products. A booming online market has enabled retailers to increase their marketing budgets, allocating more resources to direct mail campaigns.

Banks and insurance providers use direct mail advertising to market credit card and insurance policy offers to prospective customers. Direct mail advertising companies offer targeted advertising, tailoring campaigns based on financial and other demographic information.

Nonprofits rely on direct mail to reach people for fundraising or raising awareness for their causes. Meanwhile, households and government agencies hire advertisers to promote their own programs, events and materials. This group often targets specific geographies, being a group of voters, potential volunteers or donors.

Telecommunications and cable services provider companies rely on direct mail advertising to attract new clients, maintain existing clients and brand reputation, make special offers and communicate new services.

Travel companies include travel agencies, airlines and other businesses, which help get consumers from point A to B. Clubs and associations that provide discounts and general assistance in travel (e.g. AAA) are also part of the segment.

products_and_services.product_description: Full direct mail service programs include concept development, graphic design, letter shop services and printing. Business performance determines the sales of full service programs. When businesses are optimistic about the economic outlook, marketing budgets expand, allowing for more extensive advertisement campaigns and driving demand.

Printing and fulfillment services include the actual printing of coupons and flyers for mailing. These services benefit companies that have design and mailing capabilities but look to reduce costs by outsourcing printing.

Copier & Office Equipment Wholesaling in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Plastic Film, Sheet & Bag Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Credit Card Issuing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Improvements in printing technologies and digital integration have lowered the need for full services. These technologies include including the use of metallic inks, triggered direct mail and voice-activated call to action.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Lettershop Services Lower Costs for Users
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Lettershop services eliminate some time-intensive aspects of mailings, including data processing, letter assembly, poly wrapping, addressing and labeling. Producing large mailings is time-intensive without proper facilities, equipment and software, driving the need for lettershop services.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Information and Lists are Popular Among Users
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Other services include those performed on an individual basis, such as concept development, direct marketing and other advertising services. Industry segmentation has grown more advanced to incorporate data on variables, including geography, demographics and customer types.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region, being population-dense, is ideal for direct mail advertisers as it gives them access to a wider market. The region is home to both large cities and smaller towns, providing access to a diverse group of potential markets, including local businesses and corporations.

Access to a high volume of public relations and advertising companies drives the need for direct mail services in the West. Proximity to major advertising companies drives overall marketing and promotional programs for clients and eases the development of integrated marketing campaigns.

A high concentration of small businesses in the region drives sales of direct mail services, as they often rely on flyers and printed media to attract new customers. Similar to the West, the Mid-Atlantic is home to many marketing and PR agencies, allowing for better relationships with developers of marketing campaigns.

regulations_points.regulation_description: There is no law that prohibits direct mail marketing at either the federal or state level. The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) requires that direct or indirect advertising to children complies with truth-in-advertising standards. Moreover, the FTC focuses on protecting children's online privacy through the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act. The Federal Trade Commission Act furthermore has penalties for false advertising.

The FTC controls privacy laws and restrictions regarding collecting and using certain personal information, including information from medical facilities, driver's licenses, automotive registration and purchases without prior consent. The theft or misuse of a database can lead to criminal and civil penalties. Additionally, senders can receive penalties if they mail to individuals on the National Do Not Mail List.

regulations_points.regulation_title: The Deceptive Mail Prevention and Enforcement Act
regulations_points.regulation_description: The DMPEA (https://uscode.house.gov/view.xhtml?path=/prelim@title39/part4/chapter30&edition=prelim) is a federal law that regulates what you can and can't say in your solicitations and direct mail materials. The aim is to prevent recipients from getting mail that's fraudulent, sent in bad faith, or false in nature. By extension the law prevents senders from including any offers of money or impersonating a government identity.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The direct mail advertising industry is in the decline stage of its life cycle.
The level of industry assistance is low but increasing.
The level of competition is high and increasing.

basis_points.basis_description: The emergence of digital advertising threatens direct mail companies as digital media is better at targeting and reaching users, negatively affecting demand for direct mail.
Direct mail advertisers diversify their toolbox by implementing new technologies like QR codes, direct mail triggers and voice activated call to action to better target potential customers.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Due to small operations, direct mail advertisers often partner with larger companies like advertising agencies, allowing them to participate in integrated marketing campaigns while maintaining low operating costs and hiring fewer workers.

Direct mail advertisers often work with small businesses serving smaller local demographics, limiting their reach but shielding them from competition. However, this insulation only covers small-scale business.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Postage Expenses Increase Amid Budget Cuts
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Other costs include postage to deliver direct mail to consumers, information technology expenses, travel expenses, facilities costs, consulting fees and miscellaneous charges essential to operations. Other costs accounted for 43.9% of revenue in 2019 and reached 46.8% in 2024.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: ADVERTISERS MITIGATE LOSSES BY INCREASING PRODUCTIVITY
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Direct mail advertisement is labor intensive, relying on a specialized workforce for sales, analytical and graphic design services. Wages account for 22.7% of revenue in 2024, falling from 22.5% in 2019.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: PURCHASES FALL, FOLLOWING THE PRICE OF PAPER
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Spending on paper, printing machinery and mailing supplies represents 7.8% of revenue in 2024, while it accounted for 10.0% in 2019. Ink and paper are among the industry's most significant purchases, and both have experienced supply chain disruptions creating volatile circumstances for industry enterprises to budget.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: PROFIT FALLS AMID INCREASING COSTS AND LOWER DEMAND
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Major travel losses resulted in advertising profit drops, as overhead costs had to be spread among a smaller group of clients while prices competition intensified. Simultaneously, hikes in the price of paper cut into industry profitability further as costs begin to mount.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Advertisers rely highly on a specialized workforce for sales, analytical and graphic design services. But improved efficiency through technological advances lowers the need for labor.

The rate of new patent additions to the industry is low. This is combined with a low concentration of innovation. Both factors being low suggests that new technology entry is slow and widespread, which limits the threat of disruptive threats hurting leading industry operators.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Growing External Competition Affects Revenue Stability
volatility_points.volatility_description: Large commercial clients are actively switching to digital platforms for advertisement. Continued growth in the amount of business conducted online coupled with a dearth of print advertising expenditure, showcases a shift away traditional marketing mediums and towards the online space.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Target Demographics Affect the Method of Advertisement Campaigns
volatility_points.volatility_description: Companies often use hybrid advertising campaigns that incorporate direct mail with digital advertisement. Within digital and direct mail partnerships, direct mail advertisement often contributes to a less significant share of the campaign due to its lower reach.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Smaller, local companies commonly prefer to allocate resources toward direct mail advertisement
volatility_points.volatility_description: Smaller, local companies commonly prefer to allocate resources toward direct mail advertisement at it more reliably ensures that an advertisement will get in front of a targeted group.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Sales Fall at a Faster Rate Amid the Pandemic
volatility_points.volatility_description: The 2020 pandemic harmed companies by forcing them to shut down or reduce business capacity temporarily. Due to losses, businesses aimed to reduce costs, often resulting in marketing budget cuts. Lower spending on advertisement campaigns resulted in a drastic fall in revenue.

FAQs.question: What are the key privacy laws and restrictions regarding collecting and using personal information?
FAQs.answer: The FTC controls privacy laws and restrictions regarding collecting and using certain personal information, including information from medical facilities, driver's licenses, automotive registration and purchases without prior consent. The theft or misuse of a database can lead to criminal and civil penalties.

FAQs.question: What is the Deceptive Mail Prevention and Enforcement Act (DMPEA) and what does it regulate?
FAQs.answer: The DMPEA is a federal law that regulates what you can and can't say in your solicitations and direct mail materials. The aim is to prevent recipients from getting mail that's fraudulent, sent in bad faith, or false in nature. By extension the law prevents senders from including any offers of money or impersonating a government identity.

FAQs.question: What services does the Association of National Advertisers (ANA) provide?
FAQs.answer: The ANA is an international organization that conducts research, provides education, organizes conferences and offers members a library of direct marketing-related research materials. The organization has developed ethical guidelines and standards for marketing practices in addition to training materials to further marketers' careers.

FAQs.question: How are direct mailing companies responding to competition?
FAQs.answer: In response to competition, direct mailing companies are increasingly offering digital, mobile and analytics services in addition to printed marketing advertising. The companies that have fared the best in the industry in recent years tend to be those that offer advanced analytics solutions to clients.

FAQs.question: How reliant is the direct mail advertising industry on advertising revenue?
FAQs.answer: Large commercial clients are actively switching to digital platforms for advertisement. Continued growth in the amount of business conducted online coupled with a dearth of print advertising expenditure, showcases a shift away traditional marketing mediums and towards the online space. Changes in total advertising expenditure directly affect spending on direct mail advertisement.

FAQs.question: To what degree are direct mail companies' operations capital intensive?
FAQs.answer: Companies in this industry have low capital expenditures. While computing, machinery and technology assist in the design and printing process, companies rely heavily on labor. Industry enterprises have begun to invest more heavily in analytics-savvy workers than new machinery.

FAQs.question: What costs influence direct mail companies' purchase costs?
FAQs.answer: Companies are vulnerable to increases in the price of paper, as this is a major cost for operators in the industry. Industry enterprises are also sensitive to increases in postage rates.

FAQs.question: How has technology created obstacles for direct mail companies?
FAQs.answer: Despite some industry operators having success integrating digital features into print advertising, many downstream customers have moved toward entirely marketing online. It has been difficult to compete with the cost effectiveness since physical materials are not required.

FAQs.question: How has implementing new technology altered direct mail companies' service offerings?
FAQs.answer: The largest direct mailing companies have increasingly offered digital marketing and analytics services to compete with internet and mobile-based internet advertisers. Operators have also invested in cloud technologies to manage their data more efficiently. Operators have also integrated the online space with their direct mail advertisements by placing quick response (QR) codes on their mailings.

FAQs.question: How have recent regulatory changes affected direct mail companies' operations?
FAQs.answer: Since having as much data as possible on potential consumers is essential to operating a successful business in this industry, the recent regulatory changes related to consumer privacy have provided a challenge for some operators. However, interactions with QR codes and other responses to print advertising still supply a large quantity of helpful information.

FAQs.question: How has the regulatory environment changed for direct mail advertisers over the past 5 years?
FAQs.answer: The regulatory environment for direct mail advertisers has changed somewhat over the past five years. Evolving laws regarding data security and consumer privacy affect industry operators, as they maintain databases of private information for their mailing campaigns.

FAQs.question: How do direct mail companies' profit margins compare to competitors?
FAQs.answer: Despite wavering demand for direct mail advertising services, profit in this industry remains stable as the United States Postal Service continues to provide incentives and discounts to direct mailers.

FAQs.question: Has technological change had a positive effect on direct mail companies' financial performance?
FAQs.answer: Advertisers increasingly use online data management tools to collect, store, analyze and retrieve data from internal and external databases. Companies collect this data from the internet, promotions, clients and specialized mailing list companies. Once collected, the data can filter a specific mailing list into subsets to reach a target audience. Direct mail advertisers have adopted technologies that link their products to the internet, such as quick response (QR) codes.

FAQs.question: How do direct mail companies ensure timely and cost-effective delivery of campaigns?
FAQs.answer: Prompt delivery of mailed material to the required recipients within a predetermined time frame is critical. Therefore, strong working relationships with postal companies is a key success factor for industry operators. Global supply chains disruptions can lead to increasing paper prices which pressure industry profit.

FAQs.question: Do direct mail companies operate on high volume and low margins? How sensitive are they to input price increases?
FAQs.answer: Companies must be able to effectively manage a high-volume output operation but with a low net income margin. Low-margin direct mail advertisers struggle to maintain profitability while enduring substantially decreased demand. The industry is somewhat resistant to rises in key input costs, as many have long standing contracts with upstream companies at set prices.

FAQs.question: Can direct mail companies pass on cost increases to customers?
FAQs.answer: It is beneficial for enterprises to be able to pass on increases in postal and paper costs, the two major cost areas for operators. Passing on costs to clients may be a challenge due to price competition in the industry. During periods of economic uncertainty, downstream businesses must be enticed by sustained low prices, so industry enterprises have a harder time passing on any cost increases they encounter.

FAQs.question: How have direct mail companies responded to drops in demand for postal services?
FAQs.answer: Demand for postal services has struggled, as growth in online services, such as e-commerce, mobile banking and e-mail advertising, has strained demand for traditional postage. This has led to lower demand for direct mail advertising. However, direct mail advertisers have taken advantage of the now-saturated email and online marketing space by promoting their products as a visible alternative to digital channels. Additionally, advertisers have incorporated QR codes as a way to redirect physical advertisements to online marketplaces.

FAQs.question: How has the decline in number of businesses during the COVID-19 pandemic affected direct mail companies?
FAQs.answer: The number of businesses in the United States represents a downstream market for direct-mail advertisers. As the number of businesses increases, the demand for direct-mail advertising is expected to follow suit to some extent.

FAQs.question: How do direct mail companies fare when total advertising expenditure is low?
FAQs.answer: Growth in the total amount spent on advertising leads to inclines in revenue for industry enterprises. However, trends in total advertising expenditure have become divergent from trends in print advertising expenditure, which has been persistently negative and a drag on industry demand.
